result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Botwinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF1015 and 15CF1026 called: 2:01pm
State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed in 15CF1026.  VRCW

State moves to:
15CF1026 - Ct. 3 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CF1026 - Ct. 1 (Poss Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>GUILTY
15CF1026 - Ct. 2 (OWI 2nd/Repeater)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: 
14CF1015 - Cts. 1 and 2>>4 years TOTAL: 2 years incarceration and 2 years ES, on each count, concurrent to each other and to sentence in 15CF1026, w/credit for 153 days of time already served.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Payment of any financial obligation that is not paid while in prison; Absolute sobriety; AODA; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.

15CF1026 - Ct. 1>>4 years TOTAL: 2 years incarceration and 2 years ES, concurrent to sentence in 14CF1015, w/credit for 136 days of time already served.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

15CF1026 - Ct. 2 (OWI 2nd)>>5 days MCJ, concurrent to Ct. 1, w/credit for 5 days time already served; $1179 inclusive; 12 month DL Rev w/credit; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 12 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies; 

>>Defendant is eligible for both SAP and CIP on all counts in which he is serving prison sentences.
>>Defendant remanded to MCSD for delivery to WI State Prison system.

Adj: 2:23pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-18-2016 02:00 pm
SEHR (argued) set
Pre-trial conference at 01-05-2016 09:05 am.
